## Datasets

## Data Sources & Citation

The data sources used in this package are:
- mappinginequality.json: [Mapping Inequality](https://dsl.richmond.edu/panorama/redlining/): Redlining Spatial Files
- All_US_cities.csv: [GeoNames Postal Code Files](https://download.geonames.org/export/zip/): Mapping cities to counties
- Specific_US_cities.csv: City names in redlining data not reflected in All_US_cities.csv, mapped to specific counties 
- Included_Redlined_Cities.csv: List of graded redlined cities included in the package
- CenPop2020_Mean_TR.csv [US Census Bureau Centers of Population (2020)](https://www.census.gov/geographies/reference-files/time-series/geo/centers-population.2020.html): Population centers for census tracts, for population-weighted centroid method
- Life_Expectancy/USALEEP_Life_Expectancy.CSV: [USALEEP Life Expectancy](https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/nvss/usaleep/usaleep.html): Life expectancy census tract estimates
- PLACES (for various years): [CDC Places](https://www.cdc.gov/places): Mental health and physical health census tract estimates
